events.description: The release of trade data for Slovakia for the month of December 2025, showing a narrowing deficit.

facts.fact_text: Slovakia's trade deficit in December 2025 was EUR 162.7 million.

evidences.evidence_text: Slovakia posted a trade deficit of EUR 162.7 million in December 2025

facts.fact_text: Exports grew by 7% year-on-year to EUR 8,188.0 million in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Exports grew by 7% year-on-year to EUR 8,188.0 million

facts.fact_text: Imports decreased by 0.5% to EUR 8,350.7 million in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, imports decreased by 0.5% to EUR 8,350.7 million

facts.fact_text: Slovakia recorded a trade surplus of EUR 2.73 billion for the full year 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: For 2025 as a whole, Slovakia recorded a trade surplus of EUR 2.73 billion

facts.fact_text: Imports of mineral fuels declined by more than 28%.

evidences.evidence_text: largely due to a more than 28% decline in imports of mineral fuels

claims.claim_text: The growth in exports was primarily driven by machinery and transport equipment, including cars.

evidences.evidence_text: driven mainly by an almost 5% increase in shipments of machinery and transport equipment, including car exports.

claims.claim_text: The slight drop in imports was largely caused by the significant decline in mineral fuel imports.

evidences.evidence_text: The slightly drop was largely due to a more than 28% decline in imports of mineral fuels

evidence.evidence_text: driven mainly by an almost 5% increase in shipments of machinery and transport equipment, including car exports.
The slightly drop was largely due to a more than 28% decline in imports of mineral fuels
Slovakia recorded a trade surplus of EUR 2.73 billion, a EUR 63.7 million rise compared to the previous year.
